task: The user is experiencing issues with their phone service. They are unable to make or receive calls, and the status bar shows 'No Service'. Customer name: John Smith, phone number: 555-123-2002. They gave permission to pay all their overdue bills. They will consider the issue resolved when the status bar shows that they have signal.

messages.content: Hi, I’m having trouble with my phone. For the past few hours, it keeps showing 'No Service' at the top of the screen and I can't make any calls. Can you help me fix this?

I can help with that. First, I need to locate your account to check your line status.

- How would you like to verify your account?
  - Phone number on the account
  - Customer ID
  - Full name and date of birth

Also, is the phone number with the “No Service” issue the same as the one on your account, or is it a different number?
messages.reasoning_content: Plan: 1) Identify the customer using one of the allowed methods (phone number, customer ID, or full name + DOB). 2) Once identified, check their line status for suspension or billing issues. 3) Guide the user through technical diagnostics per tech_support_policy: check_status_bar, check_sim_status, check_network_status; toggle airplane mode if needed; reseat SIM if missing; check APN and reset if incorrect; reboot. 4) If line is suspended due to overdue bill, handle payment; if due to contract end date, escalate. Ask for identifier and confirm phone number affected.

messages.content: The phone number with the “No Service” issue is the same one on my account. I can verify with my phone number—it's 555-123-2002.

messages.reasoning_content: Use the provided phone number to locate the customer, then retrieve their lines to check the line’s status and whether there’s an account/line suspension or contract end issue.
Retrieve details for each line to find which one corresponds to 555-123-2002 and check its status.
Continue fetching details for remaining lines to match the problematic phone number and check its status and suspension info.

messages.content:
Thanks, I found your account and checked the line for 555-123-2002. That line is currently **Suspended**, and the suspension started today (2025-02-25). 

I also see that the line’s contract end date was 2025-01-31, which has passed. Because the contract end date is in the past, I’m unable to lift the suspension myself.

Here are your options:
- I can transfer you to a human agent who can review contract renewal options and restore service after renewal is completed.
- If you believe the contract end date listed is incorrect, I can also transfer you so a specialist can verify the contract details.

Would you like me to transfer you to a human agent now to help with renewal and restoring service?
messages.reasoning_content: Identify that line L1002 (555-123-2002) is Suspended with contract end date 2025-01-31 (past). Per policy, suspension cannot be lifted if contract end date is in the past. Prepare to explain and offer escalation to a human agent for contract renewal options.

messages.content:
Yes, please transfer me to a human agent so I can get this resolved and restore my service. Thank you.
